string.text: Mexaminum radiation protection drugs are common in the Zone. When used, this drug induces contraction of peripheral blood vessels and oxygen deprivation, which serves to treat and prevent radiation exposure. The drug does not have severe side effects, although isolated cases of mild nausea, dizziness, cramps and stomach pain have been reported.

A normal elastic bandage used to stop bleeding and prevent infection of wounds. For regular bleeding, carefully apply the bandage to the wound. For arterial bleeding, urgently tie the bandage around the affected area.
Standard issue military binoculars with a maximum of x7.5 magnification. Useful in the Zone in that they allow its owner to observe things from a distance.
Standard combat knife with a serrated blade. Useful for breaking open boxes and silently taking down enemies.
No bakers have ever been identified in the Zone, but this bread is neither contaminated nor radioactive, being fresh and quite edible. At least no complaints have been reported thus far.

Presumably, these canned goods were looted by stalkers from an army ration depot. Without any kind of label on the can, it's hard to say for sure. Should still be good to eat, if you believe the best before date.

This dated anomalous activity detector produces an alarm signal when anomalous particles enter a special chamber as you approach an anomaly. It can also register the presence of artefacts and measure the distance to the nearest one. The distance is indicated by the frequency of the sound the detector emits. To switch to artefact search mode, open the device's front cover. Due to its simple design, Echo can only be used to locate the most common artefacts.

A next generation scientific detection scanner. Thanks to three modernized detection chambers, the position of artefacts is shown on a special display screen. When closed, the device registers only radiation and anomalies. To switch to artefact search mode, open the front LED display. When in search mode, the detector is capable of locating all artefacts known to science.

A prototype of an expanded functionality anomalous frequency scanner. This device comes with a program used to identify static areas of anomalous activity stored in its database, while retaining the ability to locate artefacts. The position of anomalous areas and artefacts is displayed on a special screen. The artefact search mode, which can be activated by opening the front LED display, has been modified to detect anomalous formations currently unknown to science.
A standard head-mounted flashlight. Useful for stalkers who find themselves out and about after dark, but may attract trouble if used unwisely.

The IP2 antitoxin is a complex drug comprising several antidotes, including metoclopramidum, pyridoxine, thiamine, riboxin and other pharmaceuticals. The drug is used to inject a range of antibiotics to neutralize natural poisons, together with synthetic poison absorbers, into the bloodstream. IP2 is not particularly popular in the Zone, as most stalkers rely on a gas mask and a protective suit, there are still those who have a pack of this antidote stashed away. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

Ukrainian Vikasolum - an artificial equivalent of vitamin K. The main purpose of this drug is to increase blood coagulation speed. In great demand among stalkers who want slow-healing wounds and lacerations inflicted by mutants to close up faster. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

A drug that blocks avalanche-like nerve impulses. Consumption induces short-term loss of all emotion. Used exclusively in the Zone to counteract the effects of anomalous psi-fields. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

Often used by stalkers on long trips when no breaks can be afforded. The drink contains easily digestible carbohydrates, as well as drugs that stimulate the release of adrenaline into the bloodstream.
For better or worse, this sausage - a mix of chicken and a soy substitute - is often a stalker's breakfast, lunch and dinner in one. Can be stored for a long time due to high preservative content.

A specialized medical kit for providing first aid to combat casualties. The kit includes blood coagulants based on menadione, painkillers, antibiotics and immunostimulants, as well as a kit for removing bullets and fragments from the body. This medkit is issued to army personnel as standard and is sometimes used by Duty forces.
A general purpose single-use medical kit. Handy for treating various injuries - wounds, bruises, regular and chemical burns and various types of poisoning. In demand among stalkers.

A medical kit designed specifically for use in the Zone. The kit contains products for handling wounds, as well as preventing the development of radiation poisoning and reducing accumulated radiation in the body. Contains Vikasolum, Batilolum and Naphazoline, unlike other medkits.
Might have useful information on it.
Made by GSC. Goes down easy and considerably lowers the effects of radiation. Should be enjoyed in moderation.

This last generation anomalous activity detector can be used to locate anomalous formations and has a colour diode panel, which not only indicates the direction of artefacts, but also measures the distance to them. To switch to artefact search mode, open the device's front cover. Unfortunately, the device is programmed with a somewhat outdated list of detectable artefacts.

An experimental drug developed by Professor Ozersky for scientific research teams working in the Zone. At its core, the drug contains tetrodotoxin, known colloquially as "zombie powder," which causes a complete shutdown of the body's central nervous system that may allow people to survive emissions outside cover. The drug has not undergone clinical or field testing, which puts its effectiveness in doubt and raises the issue of possible side effects.

The main component of this product is an anabolic androgen, an artificial steroid, the chemical composition of which resembles testosterone. Often used by stalkers during long raids to reduce muscle fatigue. Significantly increases weight-carrying capacity. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

B190 Indraline radioprotectant, included in medkits issued to nuclear power plant personnel. Used in the Zone instead of the excessively toxic PC1 cystamine hydrochloride, repeated use of which often caused death. Reduces the effects of gamma radiation on live tissue. Best consumed before exposure, as effects are not instant. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.
For blues and prison romance lovers.

This belt-fed machine gun is a portable modification with a complex two-stage feeding system. Despite its weight and low precision, this LMG has found admirers in the Zone. Used primarily to fight off outnumbering enemy forces during faction conflicts and clear out mutant lairs.

A simple sheet of paper. There is nothing special about it. 
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:

%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] usable for:%c[0,170,170,170] maintenance (+2%)

Steel wool, also known as wire wool or wire sponge, is a bundle of strands of very fine soft steel filaments. It is used as an abrasive in finishing and repair work for polishing wood or metal objects, cleaning household cookware, and sanding in light painting. Steel wool is made from low-carbon steel (carbon content is low enough to be close to plain iron). It is not made by drawing "steel wool wire" through a tapered die, but rather by a process more like broaching where a heavy steel wire is pulled through a toothed die that removes a thin wire shaving. Bundles of steel wool can be used in precision equipment cleaning and to improve spreading of lubricants and cleaning solvents.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] technological item
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] usable for:%c[0,170,170,170] weapon maintenance (+6%)

Grease is a semisolid lubricant. It generally consists of a soap emulsified with mineral or vegetable oil. Greases are applied to mechanisms that cannot be lubricated constantly or where typical lubricating oil would not stay in position. They also act as sealants to prevent ingress of water and incompressible materials. Grease-lubricated bearings have greater frictional characteristics due to their high viscosity.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] technological item
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] high quality
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] usable for:%c[0,170,170,170] weapon maintenance (+6%)

Simple cloth sheet, commonly used both to patch clothing and spread oils and cleaning solvents onto firearm mechanisms. Can be applied by any needle or glue.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] everyday item
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] usable for:%c[0,170,170,170] outfit repairs, weapon maintenance (+3%)

Sheet of military-grade textile that can be used for field repairs of clothing and light armor. Valued for its relatively low price and high versatility, this material is commonly used by the Zoners. Medium-grade sewing equipment and advanced glue required for use. It can also be used to improve spread of liquids during weapon maintenance.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] military item
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] usable for:%c[0,170,170,170] outfit repairs, weapon maintenance (+4%)

Thick textile patch reinforced with kevlar padding. Can be used to repair medium and heavy armors. Large enough to cover multiple damaged areas. High quality sewing kits and adhesives are required to make use of it. Its alternative usage is weapon lubrication and cleaning - due to increased hardness it's able reach even less accessible areas of firearm parts.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] military item
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] high quality
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] usable for:%c[0,170,170,170] outfit repairs, weapon maintenance (+6%)

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] all outfits and light headgear sets
 
%c[0,170,170,170]A repair set allowing the user to perform emergency repairs of outfits. Includes military grade ducktape and ready-to-use sheets of thick textile in a variety of shapes and sizes which make it possible to quickly patch up any outfit damage. This is especially useful to prevent further structural damage of already damaged suits. Due to a relatively low durability of provided materials, the kit can be used only for minor repairs and is ineffective in case of harder materials like kevlar or metal. For this reason, the kit has a very limited use in headgear maintenance.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] technological item
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] fast usage (adhesive tape)

%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] additional repair kits %c[0,170,170,170]+6-18%
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] sewing kits %c[0,170,170,170]+3-9%

%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] cloth (sheets) %c[0,170,170,170]+2-3%

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] suited for all weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Western-made, high-quality firearm cleaning solvent, especially adapted for use in harsh environmental conditions, the Hoppe's No. 9 Bore Cleaning remains perhaps the most commonly used solution. Like all cleaning solvents, it is designed for preventing rust and removing powder, lead and metal fouling, but its unique property is that it makes heavy particles less likely to stick to mechanical parts of a firearm. This proves especially useful in the irradiated Zone. Substance acts quickly, is super-efficient, safe and easy to use. Although it flows freely and penetrates rapidly, it is still advisable to use tools or fabrics to increase spread.

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] technological item
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] liquid gun cleaning solvent

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] suited for all weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Spray can containing oil intended for lubricating and protecting firearms. Frequent application will prevent guns from malfunctioning and corroding, especially after prolonged use in combat situations. Prior to lubrication process, it is advisable to properly clean the firearm to remove any foreign material that has accumulated on or inside it. One can also make use of basic tools in order to access the inner parts of a gun so as to maximize the effectiveness of maintenance. A special tuboline increases gliding quality of all movable parts making the oil even better suited for repeaters and automatic weapons. This allows guns to function even at temperatures of up to -55 °C. It has a flash point of 78 °C.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] technological item

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] suited for all weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Iconic Red Army oil that has been in service for almost 70 years. The metal bottle is divided into two separate compartments, one for oil and the other one for the cleaning solvent. In the beginning, the solvent was based on an alkaline solution for effective clean-up of preservation salts in which ammunition was commonly shipped and stored. Since then, the composition of liquids has been modernized many times, but the simple yet ingenious 'double' bottle design remained unchanged. "Dvojka" is very popular in the Exclusion Zone due to its versatility. Bear in mind, however, that the oil requires adequate tools to be spread properly and so that it can reach deep into weapon's inner mechanisms. "Dvojka" should thus be regarded as more of an add-on than a stand-alone maintenance item.

%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] suited for all weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Plastic bottle containing a budget Russian mineral gun oil. Despite its low price, it can prove useful in keeping a firearm in a good condition if applied frequently. It should be used alongside brushes for increased effect. According to the manufacturer, "Rusak" is especially effective for automatic and repeatable weapons due to low friction coefficient. It also contains various anti-corrosion and metal-preserving additives.

%c[0,170,170,170]Cheapest of the synthetic adhesives available in the Zone, this epoxy-based solution may be used to put together slightly torn pieces of fabric or to patch up a small hole in your helmet, but it will be useless in case of any serious damage. On the other hand, "Zviezda" has a great value for price, and if used on a regular basis it's able to keep your outfit in a good shape at all times. It is advised to use any type of commonly found materials to greatly increase effectiveness of repair. The glue, however, won't support mutant skins. Can also be used to facilitate sewing.

%c[0,170,170,170]Advanced glue produced by the Ukrainian chemical industry, modified epoxy-based adhesive "Tur" is able to quickly bind most solid materials. Versatility and ease of use are the two reasons why "Tur" is kept in such a high regard among stalkers, especially since spare materials are scarce. The glue binds both textile fabrics and lighter protective materials like kevlar, but is useless when it comes to metals.

%c[0,170,170,170]M17 is a result of a Soviet military-industrial research project intended to devise an extremely potent, single-ingredient adhesive which could be used in any situation regardless of purpose and materials involved. It was decided to use a highly potent methacrylate which is most often optimized for reacting with either plastic or metal. In case of M17, however, this limitation has been bypassed, making the substance equally effective in both areas. In addition, the adhesive received a significant boost to versatility thanks to its hydrate form: it can be diluted with water and used in any concentration depending on the intended result. There is almost no damage that the glue, combined with appropriate materials, won't be able to repair.

Stops the mental effects on the brain, restores mental health.

Elite medical kit, designed specifically for use in the Zone. The set includes specific medicines and dressings for treating combat wounds and serum for radionuclide removal from the organism. Prevents radiation sickness development, restores energy and reduces the cumulative radiation dose.
Enhanced wound dressing. Stops bleeding and helps wound healing.

Ingredients: artificially created steroids, indralin-B190, hydrochloride, vicasol, metoclopramide, pyridoxine, thiamin, riboksin and others. This long-acting drug brings into the blood substances which are able to decompose protein toxins, as well as absorbents of synthetic poisons. The drug is the strongest among this kind.
